channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report X-2023070934
item.description:
Report X-2023070934

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070934 SequenceEvent: Steel Drum was damaged while being unloaded from trailer. Drum was placed in a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Steel drum was damaged at the bottom from dents and punctured holes. Paint was seen leaking out from the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Steel drum was placed in a red tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection while using proper eye gear and wear. 2. X-2023070944 SequenceEvent: Steel Drum was damaged while being unloaded from trailer during sort. Drum was placed in a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: During inspection there was a loose cap at the top with spilled paint. There was dents on the bottom and both sides. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Steel Drum was placed in a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. Proper eye gear and were used to transport paint to cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070875
item.description:
Report X-2023070875

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-08
  • City: SAINT ROSE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found with a wet spot on the outside of the box after unloading off of the truck. QA placed the hazmat inside of the bin and brought to the hazmat cage for further inspection. upon inspection the cap on the hazmat was loose and caused mini leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on bottle of hazmat caused a minor leakage damaging the box it was inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was found leaking, the package was immediately placed inside of the hazmat bin to mitigate the leak.

item.title: Report X-2023070756
item.description:
Report X-2023070756

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: CARENCRO
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The metal drum was found on a roller on belt line. Drum was placed in hazmat bag inside hazmat drum and brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection found no outer packaging on drum. No handle on drum. Drum was dented, scratched and leaking from bottom of drum. DescribePack: There are multiple dents in drum. There are multiple scratches sides of drum. Drum is leaking from bottom of drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Metal drum was found on roller. It was immediately placed in blue hazmat bag, then placed in yellow hazmat drum. It was brought to QA hazmat cage for inspection.

item.title: Report E-2023070684
item.description:
Report E-2023070684

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the poly 55 gallon drum s of batericide (un1993) releasing 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023070934
item.description:
Report E-2023070934

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: SAINT GABRIEL
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 4
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC trailer was being cleaned following delivery. There was some residual Toluene Diisocyanate remaining the the delivery hose that was released. It is estimated that less than one gallon of product was spilled. ES&H Environmental responded and handled the remediation. Four employees who were exposed to the spilled product were treated and released by a local medical facility.

item.title: Report E-2023070390
item.description:
Report E-2023070390

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the cap was damaged on one of the metal 55 gallon drum of glycidyl methacrylate (un2922) and that 5 ounces had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report I-2023050039
item.description:
Report I-2023050039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T00:23:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-07
  • City: KENNER
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During descent, the purser, informed Fa01 ,that his a-cigarette battery was overheated. He contacted the flight deck and immediately we placed the overheated a-cigarette device in the TCB and locked it in aft lavatory.
